intro: Euphrasia simonkaiana, commonly known as Simonka's eyebright, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers have five petals and prominent yellow markings. Euphrasia simonkaiana is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
